alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 1:33PM CDT until June 8 at 6:40PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Henderson and Navarro
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Trinidad.

* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, Minor flooding to woodlands and low land
areas will occur on the right bank of the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 36.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 33.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 20.0 feet early
Thursday afternoon.
alerts.areaDesc: Henderson, TX; Navarro, TX

alerts.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 7 at 1:34PM CDT until June 8 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Temperatures up to 105 expected.

* WHERE...Andrews, Crane, Ector, Martin, Midland, and Winkler
Counties.

* WHEN...From 1 PM to 9 PM CDT Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Pets may succumb to the effects of extreme heat. The
elderly, very young, sick, and people with heart conditions are
most at risk in extreme heat.
alerts.areaDesc: Andrews; Martin; Winkler; Ector; Midland; Crane

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 11:51AM CDT until June 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Angelina, Houston and
Anderson Counties.

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Expect moderate to severe flooding of the
heavily wooded floodplain. Boat ramps and picnic areas will be
completely inundated.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 11:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 11:15 AM CDT Saturday was 17.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 15.4 feet
Thursday morning.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Anderson, TX; Angelina, TX; Cherokee, TX; Houston, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:51AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County.

Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers
Counties.

Trinity River at Riverside affecting San Jacinto, Polk, Trinity
and Walker Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River near Moss Bluff.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 15.2 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins in the
vicinity of the gage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 9.2 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 AM CDT Saturday was 13.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 14.3 feet early
Wednesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible
thereafter.
- Flood stage is 12.2 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
14.3 feet on 02/10/1992.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Chambers, TX; Liberty, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 11:54AM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Sabine River Near Mineola affecting Smith and Wood Counties.

For the Sabine River...including Mineola, Hawkins, Gladewater,
Longview, Beckville, Logansport...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Sabine River near Mineola.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Tuesday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect flooding of secondary roadways with
picnic and recreational areas flooded as well.  Also expect
flooded boat ramps as well.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 11:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.8 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0
feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage
Monday morning.
- Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Smith, TX; Wood, TX

alerts.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
alerts.description:
At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong
thunderstorms near Persimmon Gap, or 22 miles north of Panther
Junction, moving southeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is
possible.

Locations impacted include...
Boquillas Canyon, Persimmon Gap, and Big Bend National Park.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:51AM CDT until June 8 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County.

Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers
Counties.

Trinity River at Riverside affecting San Jacinto, Polk, Trinity
and Walker Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 134.3 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 132.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 AM CDT Saturday was 134.9 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 131.3 feet Thursday
morning.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.3 feet on 05/14/2004.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

AREAS

DALLAM                HARTLEY               OLDHAM

alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Nacogdoches and Angelina
Counties.

For the Angelina River...including Alto, NACOGDOCHES, Lufkin...Minor
flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 165.0 feet, Expect flooding to continue for several
days with the majority of the gravel access roadway flooded.
Boaters and four wheel-operators should use caution traversing
both upstream and downstream on the Angelina River as currents can
become swift and turbulent.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 11:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 163.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 11:30 AM CDT Saturday was 163.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 163.7
feet Tuesday morning.
- Flood stage is 161.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 134.3 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 132.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 AM CDT Saturday was 134.9 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 131.3 feet Thursday
morning.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.3 feet on 05/14/2004.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Liberty.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins as homes in
several subdivisions above Liberty begin flooding. Extensive
flooding over much of Liberty County can be expected with each
incremental rise in the river.

- Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet.

Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter.
- Flood stage is 26.0 feet.

28.4 feet on 02/11/1992.

alerts.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 7 at 7:14PM CDT until June 7 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
alerts.description:
At 714 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of
Sedan, or 10 miles northeast of Amistad, moving southeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail
damage to vehicles is expected.

Locations impacted include...
Romero.
alerts.areaDesc: Dallam, TX; Hartley, TX

alerts.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Watch issued June 7 at 4:04PM CDT until June 7 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
alerts.description:
THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH
387 IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING
AREAS

IN TEXAS THIS WATCH INCLUDES 3 COUNTIES

IN THE PANHANDLE OF TEXAS

DALLAM                HARTLEY               OLDHAM

THIS INCLUDES THE CITIES OF BOYS RANCH, CHANNING, CONLEN,
DALHART, HARTLEY, ROMERO, VEGA, WARE, AND WILDORADO.
